util.math

Class Bezier

  • java.lang.Object
    • util.math.Bezier

  • public final class Bezier
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class containing everything math related
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    EPICI

    • Method Summary

      static double accurateBezier2(double a, double b, double t)
      At the cost of one more operation, is more accurate
      static double accurateDecasteljauBezier(double[] ds, double t)
      More accurate but slower variant of De Casteljau's
      static double bezier(double[] ds, double t)
      Bezier with more points
      O(n) algorithm using cheats
      static double bezier(double t, double... ds)
      Bezier with more points
      Redirects to the one that takes an array
      static double bezier2(double a, double b, double t)
      Standard 2 point bezier
      Wikipedia
      static double bezier2to4(double a, double b, double t)
      Fast bezier4 for (a,a,b,b)
      Polynomial expanded and refactored to do far less work
      static double decasteljauBezier(double[] ds, double t)
      Actual De Casteljau's algorithm, has O(n^2) running time
      https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/De_Casteljau%27s_algorithm
      Please don't use it, the only advantage it offers is stability, but honestly you shouldn't ever have hundreds of control points

        public static double bezier2(double a,
                             double b,
                             double t)
        Standard 2 point bezier
        Wikipedia
        Parameters:
        a - the first value to interpolate between
        b - the second value to interpolate between
        t - interpolation value, must be between 0 and 1
        Returns:
        the interpolated value

      • bezier

        public static double bezier(double[] ds,
                            double t)
        Bezier with more points
        O(n) algorithm using cheats
        Parameters:
        t - interpolation value, must be between 0 and 1
        ds - values to interpolate between
        Returns:
        the interpolated value

      • decasteljauBezier

        public static double decasteljauBezier(double[] ds,
                                       double t)
        Actual De Casteljau's algorithm, has O(n^2) running time
        https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/De_Casteljau%27s_algorithm
        Please don't use it, the only advantage it offers is stability, but honestly you shouldn't ever have hundreds of control points
        Parameters:
        ds - double array contianing the points
        t - the interpolation value, must be between 0 and 1
        Returns:
        the interpolated value

        More accurate but slower variant of De Casteljau's
        Parameters:
        ds - double array contianing the points
        t - the interpolation value, must be between 0 and 1
        Returns:
        the interpolated value

      • bezier2to4

        public static double bezier2to4(double a,
                                double b,
                                double t)
        Fast bezier4 for (a,a,b,b)
        Polynomial expanded and refactored to do far less work
        Parameters:
        a - the first point to interpolate between
        b - the second point to interpolate between
        t - the interpolation value, must be between 0 and 1
        Returns:
        the interpolated value
